alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 11:25AM EST until January 14 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EST FOR OTSEGO...SOUTHEASTERN BROOME...NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE...SOUTHEASTERN CHENANGO AND CENTRAL SUSQUEHANNA COUNTIES... At 1125 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Richfield Springs to near Montrose, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 1 and near 2 East. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 75 and 84. Interstate 88 between 5 and 17. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 217 and 230. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Kirkwood, Conklin, Sidney, Jackson, Guilford, Sanford, Middlefield, Hartwick, and Susquehanna. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
